Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a heart-shaped nozzle (damaged), decorated on the discus with a rabbit eating grapes. The shoulder is decorated with impressed ovules. The lamp stands on a raised base. Covered with a red to dark brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2016)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Museum of Practical Geology
